Module kivakit.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.progress.reporters

Class BroadcastingProgressReporter

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
com.telenav.kivakit.core.progress.reporters.BroadcastingProgressReporter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Broadcaster, MessageTransceiver, Transceiver, ProgressReporter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.lifecycle.Resettable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Nameable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConcurrentBroadcastingProgressReporter
public class BroadcastingProgressReporter extends Multicaster implements ProgressReporter
A progress reporter that sends progress messages to a Listener as an operation proceeds. BroadcastingProgressReporter reporting on an operation is started with start(String). At each step, next() or next(long) should be called to report progress. When the operation is over end(String, Object...) should be called.

Example - Broadcasting Progress of an Operation 

 var progress = progressReporter(this, "bytes");
 progress.start("Downloading")
 while ([...])
 {
     [...]

     progress.next();
 }
 progress.end("Downloaded");

Example - Listening to the Progress of an Operation 

 progress.listener(percent -> System.out.println("$ complete", percent);
BroadcastingProgressReporter is not thread-safe. To report progress in a multi-threaded operations, use ConcurrentBroadcastingProgressReporter.

Progress

  • at() - The current point in the operation
  • at(long) - Sets the current point in the operation
  • end(String, Object...) - Ends the operation
  • next() - Moves to the next step
  • ProgressReporter.next(Count) - Moves ahead by the given number of steps
  • next(int) - Moves ahead by the given number of steps
  • next(long) - Moves ahead by the given number of steps
  • phase(String) - Sets the phase of the operation
  • reset() - Resets progress to step 0
  • ProgressReporter.start() - Starts the operation
  • start(String) - Starts the operation, transmitting the given label
  • steps() - Returns the number of steps in the operation
  • steps(BaseCount) - Sets the number of steps in the operation
  • withPhase(String) - This reporter with the given phase
  • withSteps(BaseCount) - This reporter with the given number of steps
  • withUnits(String) - This reporter with the given item name, specifying the units
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

      public void next()
      Report the next step in the operation. This is often fine-grained such as processing a single node or way in a data file. The implementation in BroadcastingProgressReporter of this interface is designed to be efficient in this way.
      Specified by:
      next in interface ProgressReporter

    • progressReporter

      public BroadcastingProgressReporter progressReporter(ProgressListener listener)
